location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 2747/41 'Method to be adopted in Sending telegrams to the Gulf.'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf and the Secretary of State for India querying, and subsequently confirming, the security of sending cyphered telegrams to the Gulf by wireless.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
